<a name="4.645"></a>
<p><h3>4.645 Selected Topics in Architecture: 1750 to the Present
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">)
<br>Prereq: <a href="m4b.html#4.210">4.210</a> or permission of instructor
<br>Units: 3-0-6
<br><a href="https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4645">https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4645</a>
<br><b>Lecture:</b> <i>MW11-12.30</i> (<a href="http://whereis.mit.edu/map-jpg?mapterms=5">5-234</a>)<!--s-->
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>General study of modern architecture as a response to important technological, cultural, environmental, aesthetic, and theoretical challenges after the European Enlightenment. Focus on the theoretical, historiographic, and design approaches to architectural problems encountered in the age of industrial and post-industrial expansion across the globe, with specific attention to the dominance of European modernism in setting the agenda for the discourse of a global modernity at large. Explores modern architectural history through thematic exposition rather than as simple chronological succession of ideas.
<br><I>A. Dutta</I><br>No textbook information available
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.646"></a>
<p><h3>4.646 Advanced Study in the History of Modern Architecture and Urbanism
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">) <img src="/icns/repeat.gif" alt="Can be repeated for credit" title="Can be repeated for credit" width=16 height=16 align="bottom">
<br>Prereq: Permission of instructor
<br>Units arranged
<br><b>4.646:</b> <a href="https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4646">https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4646</a>
<br><b>4.646:</b> <b>Lecture:</b> <i>M10-1</i> (<a href="http://whereis.mit.edu/map-jpg?mapterms=5">5-216</a>)<!--s-->
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Seminar in a selected topic in the history of modern architecture and urbanism. Oral presentations and research paper required.
<br><I>T. Hyde</I><br><b>4.646:</b> No textbook information available
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.647"></a>
<p><h3>4.647 Technopolitics, Culture, Intervention
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Not offered academic year 2017-2018" title="Not offered academic year 2017-2018" src="/icns/nooffer.gif"><img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Fall" title="Fall" src="/icns/fall.gif">)
<br>Prereq: <a href="m4f.html#4.645">4.645</a> or permission of instructor
<br>Units arranged
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Examines the manner in which key theories of technology have influenced architectural and art production in terms of their "humanizing" claims. Students test theories of technology on the grounds of whether technology is good or bad for humans. Limited to 15; preference to MArch students.
<br>Staff<br>
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.648"></a>
<p><h3>4.648[J] Resonance: Sonic Experience, Science, and Art
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Not offered academic year 2017-2018" title="Not offered academic year 2017-2018" src="/icns/nooffer.gif"><img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Undergrad" title="Undergrad" src="/icns/under.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Fall" title="Fall" src="/icns/fall.gif">) <img src="/icns/hassA.gif" alt="HASS Arts" title="HASS Arts" width="16" height="16" align="bottom">
<br>(Same subject as <A HREF="m21Aa.html#21A.507">21A.507[J]</A>)<br>(Subject meets with <A HREF="m4f.html#4.649">4.649[J]</A>, <A HREF="m21Aa.html#21A.519">21A.519[J]</A>)
<br>Prereq: None
<br>Units: 3-0-9
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Examines the sonic phenomena and experiences that motivate scientific, humanistic, and artistic practices. Explores the aesthetic and technical aspects of how we hear; measure or describe vibrations; record, compress, and distribute resonating materials; and how we ascertain what we know about the world through sound. Although the focus is on sound as an aesthetic, social, and scientific object, the subject also investigates how resonance is used in the analysis of acoustics, architecture, and music theory. Students make a sonic artifact or research project as a final requirement. Students taking graduate version complete additional assignments.
<br>Staff<br>
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.649"></a>
<p><h3>4.649[J] Resonance: Sonic Experience, Science, and Art
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Not offered academic year 2017-2018" title="Not offered academic year 2017-2018" src="/icns/nooffer.gif"><img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Fall" title="Fall" src="/icns/fall.gif">)
<br>(Same subject as <A HREF="m21Aa.html#21A.519">21A.519[J]</A>)<br>(Subject meets with <A HREF="m4f.html#4.648">4.648[J]</A>, <A HREF="m21Aa.html#21A.507">21A.507[J]</A>)
<br>Prereq: None
<br>Units: 3-0-9
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Examines the sonic phenomena and experiences that motivate scientific, humanistic, and artistic practices. Explores the aesthetic and technical aspects of how we hear; measure or describe vibrations; record, compress, and distribute resonating materials; and how we ascertain what we know about the world through sound. Although the focus is on sound as an aesthetic, social, and scientific object, the subject also investigates how resonance is used in the analysis of acoustics, architecture, and music theory. Students make a sonic artifact or research project as a final requirement. Students taking graduate version complete additional assignments.
<br>Staff<br>
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.650"></a>
<p><h3>4.650 A Global History of Architecture
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">)
<br>(Subject meets with <A HREF="m4f.html#4.605">4.605</A>)
<br>Prereq: None
<br>Units: 4-0-8
<br><a href="https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4605">https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4605</a>
<br><b>Lecture:</b> <i>MW11-12.30</i> (<a href="http://whereis.mit.edu/map-jpg?mapterms=3">3-133</a>) <b>Recitation:</b> <i>W1</i> (<a href="http://whereis.mit.edu/map-jpg?mapterms=5">5-216</a>) or <i>F12</i> (<a href="http://whereis.mit.edu/map-jpg?mapterms=5">5-216</a>) <i><b>+final</b></i><!--s-->
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Provides an outline of the history of architecture and urbanism from ancient times to the early modern period. Analyzes buildings as the products of culture and in relation to the special problems of architectural design. Stresses the geopolitical context of buildings and in the process familiarizes students with buildings, sites and cities from around the world. Additional work required of graduate students.
<br>Staff<br>No textbook information available
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.651"></a>
<p><h3>4.651 Art Since 1940
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Not offered academic year 2017-2018" title="Not offered academic year 2017-2018" src="/icns/nooffer.gif"><img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Undergrad" title="Undergrad" src="/icns/under.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">) <img src="/icns/hassA.gif" alt="HASS Arts" title="HASS Arts" width="16" height="16" align="bottom">
<br>Prereq: None
<br>Units: 3-0-9
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Critical examination of major developments in European, Asian, and American art from 1940 to the present. Surveys the mainstream of art production but also examines marginal phenomena (feminism, identity politics, AIDS activism, net art) that come to change the terms of arts engagements with civic culture. Visits to area art museums and writing assignments develop skills for visual analysis and critical writing.
<br>Staff<br>
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.652"></a>
<p><h3>4.652 Modern Art and Mass Culture
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Not offered academic year 2018-2019" title="Not offered academic year 2018-2019" src="/icns/nonext.gif"><img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">)
<br>(Subject meets with <A HREF="m4f.html#4.602">4.602</A>)
<br>Prereq: None
<br>Units arranged
<br><a href="https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4602">https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4602</a>
<br><b>Lecture:</b> <i>M2-5</i> (<a href="http://whereis.mit.edu/map-jpg?mapterms=3">3-133</a>) <b>Recitation:</b> <i>W12</i> (<a href="http://whereis.mit.edu/map-jpg?mapterms=5">5-216</a>) or <i>F12</i> (<a href="http://whereis.mit.edu/map-jpg?mapterms=5">5-231</a>) <i><b>+final</b></i><!--s-->
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Introduction to theories of modernism and postmodernism and their related forms (roughly 18th century to present) in art and design. Focuses on how artists use the tension between fine art and mass culture to critique both. Examines visual art in a range of genres, from painting to design objects and "relational aesthetics." Works of art are viewed in their interaction with advertising, caricature, comics, graffiti, television, fashion, "primitive" art, propaganda, and networks on the internet. Additional work required of students taking the graduate version.
<br><I>R. Uchill</I><br>No textbook information available
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.657"></a>
<p><h3>4.657 Design: The History of Making Things
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Undergrad" title="Undergrad" src="/icns/under.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">) <img src="/icns/hassA.gif" alt="HASS Arts" title="HASS Arts" width="16" height="16" align="bottom"> <img src="/icns/cih1.gif" alt="Communication Intensive HASS" title="Communication Intensive HASS" width="28" height="16" align="bottom">
<br>Prereq: None
<br>Units: 5-0-7
<br><a href="https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4657">https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4657</a>
<br><b>Lecture:</b> <i>TR11-12.30</i> (<a href="http://whereis.mit.edu/map-jpg?mapterms=3">3-133</a>) <b>Recitation:</b> <i>W10</i> (<a href="http://whereis.mit.edu/map-jpg?mapterms=5">5-216</a>) or <i>F10</i> (<a href="http://whereis.mit.edu/map-jpg?mapterms=5">5-216</a>)<!--s-->
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Examines themes in the history of design, with emphasis on Euro-American theory and practice in their global contexts. Addresses the historical design of communications, objects, and environments as meaningful processes of decision-making, adaptation, and innovation. Critically assesses the dynamic interaction of design with politics, economics, technology, and culture in the past and at present. Limited to 36.
<br><I>K. Smentek</I><br>No textbook information available
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.661"></a>
<p><h3>4.661 Theory and Method in the Study of Architecture and Art
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Fall" title="Fall" src="/icns/fall.gif">) <img src="/icns/repeat.gif" alt="Can be repeated for credit" title="Can be repeated for credit" width=16 height=16 align="bottom">
<br>Prereq: Permission of instructor
<br>Units: 3-0-9
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Studies theoretical and historiographical works pertaining to the fields of art and architectural history. Members of seminar pursue work designed to examine their own presuppositions and methods. Open only to PhD candidates and other advanced students.
<br><I>A. Dutta</I><br>
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.670"></a>
<p><h3>4.670 Nationalism, Internationalism, and Globalism in Modern Art
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Not offered academic year 2017-2018" title="Not offered academic year 2017-2018" src="/icns/nooffer.gif"><img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">)
<br>(Subject meets with <A HREF="m4f.html#4.671">4.671</A>)
<br>Prereq: None
<br>Units arranged
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Studies how international modernism interacted with the concept of "nation" and how contemporary discourses concerning globalism changes that dynamic. Looks at how art uses and critiques globalization on various levels. Seminar attendance and visits to art museums required. Research paper required of students taking the graduate version.
<br>Staff<br>
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.671"></a>
<h3>4.671 Nationalism, Internationalism, and Globalism in Modern Art
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Not offered academic year 2017-2018" title="Not offered academic year 2017-2018" src="/icns/nooffer.gif"><img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Undergrad" title="Undergrad" src="/icns/under.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">)
<br>(Subject meets with <A HREF="m4f.html#4.670">4.670</A>)
<br>Prereq: <a href="m4f.html#4.601">4.601</a> or permission of instructor
<br>Units: 3-1-8
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Studies how international modernism interacted with the concept of "nation" and how contemporary discourses concerning globalism changes that dynamic. Looks at how art uses and critiques globalization on various levels. Seminar attendance and visits to art museums required. Research paper required of students taking the graduate version.
<br>Staff<br>
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.675"></a>
<p><h3>4.675 Collect, Classify, Consume
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">) <img src="/icns/repeat.gif" alt="Can be repeated for credit" title="Can be repeated for credit" width=16 height=16 align="bottom">
<br>Prereq: None
<br>Units arranged
<br><a href="https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4675">https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4675</a>
<br><b>Lecture:</b> <i>F2-5</i> (<a href="http://whereis.mit.edu/map-jpg?mapterms=5">5-216</a>)<!--s-->
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Historical study of collecting from the Renaissance to the present. Addresses the practices of collecting and display at the both the individual and institutional level, and analyzes their social, aesthetic, scientific, political and economic dimensions. Specific themes vary from year to year. Offered for 9 or 12 units. May be repeated for credit with permission of instructor.
<br><I>K. Smentek</I><br>No textbook information available
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.677"></a>
<p><h3>4.677 Advanced Study in the History of Art
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Fall" title="Fall" src="/icns/fall.gif">) <img src="/icns/repeat.gif" alt="Can be repeated for credit" title="Can be repeated for credit" width=16 height=16 align="bottom">
<br>Prereq: Permission of instructor
<br>Units arranged
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Seminar in a selected topic in the history of art, with a particular emphasis on developments from the 18th century to the present. Oral presentations and research paper required. Offered for 9 or 12 units.
<br><I>K. Smentek</I><br>
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.683"></a>
<p><h3>4.683 Preparation for HTC Qualifying Paper
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Fall" title="Fall" src="/icns/fall.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">)
<br>Prereq: Permission of instructor
<br>Units arranged [P/D/F]
<br><a href="https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4683">https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4683</a>
<br>TBA. <!--s-->
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Required of doctoral students in HTC as a prerequisite for work on the doctoral dissertation. The qualifying paper is a scholarly article fit to be published in a peer-reviewed journal that is the result of research in the history, theory and criticism of architecture and art. Topic may not be in the area of the proposed thesis. Work is done in consultation with HTC faculty, in accordance with the HTC PhD Degree Program Guidelines. Restricted to HTC PhD students.
<br>Fall: <I>R. Caso</I><br>Spring: <I>R. Caso</I><br>No required or recommended textbooks
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.684"></a>
<p><h3>4.684 Preparation for HTC Major Exam
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Fall" title="Fall" src="/icns/fall.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">)
<br>Prereq: permission of instructor
<br>Units arranged [P/D/F]
<br><a href="https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4684">https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4684</a>
<br>TBA. <!--s-->
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Required of doctoral students in HTC as a prerequisite for work on the doctoral dissertation. The Major Exam covers a historically broad area of interest and includes components of history, historiography, and theory. Preparation for the exam will focus on four or five themes agreed upon in advance by the student and the examiner, and are defined by their area of teaching interest. Work is done in consultation with HTC faculty, in accordance with the HTC PhD Degree Program Guidelines. Restricted to HTC PhD students.
<br>Fall: <I>R. Caso</I><br>Spring: <I>R. Caso</I><br>No required or recommended textbooks
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.685"></a>

Work is done in consultation with HTC faculty, in accordance with the HTC PhD Degree Program Guidelines. Restricted to HTC PhD students.
<br>Fall: <I>R. Caso</I><br>Spring: <I>R. Caso</I><br>No required or recommended textbooks
</p><!--end-->

<p><h3>4.686 SMArchS AKPIA Pre-Thesis Preparation
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Fall" title="Fall" src="/icns/fall.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">)
<br>Prereq: <a href="m4b.html#4.221">4.221</a>; <a href="m4f.html#4.619">4.619</a> or <a href="m4f.html#4.621">4.621</a>
<br>Units: 0-1-2 [P/D/F]
<br><a href="https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4686">https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4686</a>
<br><b>Lecture:</b> <i>M11-2</i> (<a href="http://whereis.mit.edu/map-jpg?mapterms=3">3-329</a>)<!--s-->
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Preliminary study in preparation for the thesis for the SMArchS degree in the Aga Khan Program for Islamic Architecture. Topics include literature search, precedents examination, thesis structure and typologies, and short writing exercise.
<br>Fall: <I>C. Stewart</I><br>Spring: <I>J. Wescoat</I><br>No required or recommended textbooks
</p><!--end-->

<a name="4.689"></a>
<p><h3>4.689 Preparation for History, Theory, and Criticism - Ph.D. Thesis
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Fall" title="Fall" src="/icns/fall.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Summer" title="Summer" src="/icns/summer.gif">) <img src="/icns/repeat.gif" alt="Can be repeated for credit" title="Can be repeated for credit" width=16 height=16 align="bottom">
<br>Prereq: Permission of instructor
<br>Units arranged [P/D/F]
<br><a href="https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4689">https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4689</a>
<br>TBA. <!--s-->
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Required for doctoral students in HTC as a prerequisite for work on the doctoral dissertation. Prior to candidacy, doctoral students are required to write and orally defend a proposal laying out the scope of their thesis, its significance, a survey of existing research and literature, the methods of research to be adopted, a bibliography and plan of work. Work is done in consultation with HTC Faculty, in accordance with the HTC PhD Degree Program guidelines. Restricted to HTC PhD students.
<br>Fall: <I>R. Caso</I><br>Spring: <I>R. Caso</I><br>No required or recommended textbooks
</p><!--end-->

<p><h3>4.S60 Special Subject: History, Theory and Criticism of Architecture and Art
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Undergrad" title="Undergrad" src="/icns/under.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="IAP" title="IAP" src="/icns/iap.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">) <img src="/icns/repeat.gif" alt="Can be repeated for credit" title="Can be repeated for credit" width=16 height=16 align="bottom"><br>Not offered regularly; consult department
<br>Prereq: None
<br>Units arranged
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Seminar or lecture on a topic in the history, theory and criticism of architecture and art that is not covered in the regular curriculum. Requires original research and presentation of oral and written reports and/or design projects, varying at the discretion of the instructor.
<br>Staff<br>
</p><!--end-->

<a name="4.S63"></a>
<p><h3>4.S63 Special Subject: History, Theory and Criticism of Architecture and Art
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Fall" title="Fall" src="/icns/fall.gif">) <img src="/icns/repeat.gif" alt="Can be repeated for credit" title="Can be repeated for credit" width=16 height=16 align="bottom"><br>Not offered regularly; consult department
<br>Prereq: Permission of instructor
<br>Units arranged
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Seminar or lecture on a topic in the history, theory and criticism of architecture and art that is not covered in the regular curriculum. Requires original research and presentation of oral and written reports and/or design projects, varying at the discretion of the instructor.
<br>Staff<br>
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.S64"></a>
<h3>4.S64 Special Subject: History, Theory and Criticism of Architecture and Art
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">) <img src="/icns/repeat.gif" alt="Can be repeated for credit" title="Can be repeated for credit" width=16 height=16 align="bottom">
<br>Prereq: Permission of instructor
<br>Units arranged [P/D/F]
<br><a href="https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4s64">https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4s64</a>
<br><b>Lecture:</b> <i>M2-5</i> (<a href="http://whereis.mit.edu/map-jpg?mapterms=3">3-329</a>)<!--s-->
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Seminar or lecture on a topic in the history, theory and criticism of architecture and art that is not covered in the regular curriculum. Requires original research and presentation of oral and written reports and/or design projects, varying at the discretion of the instructor.
<br><I>M. Jarzombek</I><br>No textbook information available
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.S65"></a>
<p><h3>4.S65 Special Subject: Advanced Study in Islamic Architecture
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="IAP" title="IAP" src="/icns/iap.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">) <img src="/icns/repeat.gif" alt="Can be repeated for credit" title="Can be repeated for credit" width=16 height=16 align="bottom"><br>Not offered regularly; consult department
<br>Prereq: Permission of instructor
<br>Units arranged
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Seminar or lecture on a topic in Islamic or non-western architecture that is not covered in the regular curriculum. Requires original research and presentation of oral and written reports, varying at the discretion of the instructor.
<br>Staff<br>
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.S66"></a>
<p><h3>4.S66 Special Subject: History, Theory and Criticism of Art
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="IAP" title="IAP" src="/icns/iap.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">) <img src="/icns/repeat.gif" alt="Can be repeated for credit" title="Can be repeated for credit" width=16 height=16 align="bottom"><br>Not offered regularly; consult department
<br>Prereq: Permission of instructor
<br>Units arranged
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Seminar or lecture on a topic in the history, theory and criticism of art that is not covered in the regular curriculum. Requires original research and presentation of oral and written reports and/or design projects, varying at the discretion of the instructor.
<br>Staff<br>
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.S67"></a>
<p><h3>4.S67 Special Subject: Study in Modern Art
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Fall" title="Fall" src="/icns/fall.gif">) <img src="/icns/repeat.gif" alt="Can be repeated for credit" title="Can be repeated for credit" width=16 height=16 align="bottom"><br>Not offered regularly; consult department
<br>Prereq: Permission of instructor
<br>Units arranged
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Seminar or lecture on a topic in the history, theory and criticism of modern art that is not covered in the regular curriculum. Requires original research and presentation of oral and written reports and/or design projects, varying at the discretion of the instructor.
<br>Staff<br>
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.S68"></a>
<p><h3>4.S68 Special Subject: Study in Modern Architecture
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">) <img src="/icns/repeat.gif" alt="Can be repeated for credit" title="Can be repeated for credit" width=16 height=16 align="bottom">

<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Seminar or lecture on a topic in the history, theory and criticism of modern architecture that is not covered in the regular curriculum. Requires original research and presentation of oral and written reports and/or design projects, varying at the discretion of the instructor.
<br><I>K. Forster</I><br>No textbook information available
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.S69"></a>

<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="IAP" title="IAP" src="/icns/iap.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">) <img src="/icns/repeat.gif" alt="Can be repeated for credit" title="Can be repeated for credit" width=16 height=16 align="bottom"><br>Not offered regularly; consult department

<h1 align="center">Course 4: Architecture<br>IAP / Spring
2018</h1><div id="contentmini"><b><a href="http://architecture.mit.edu/"><i>Course 4 Home</i></a>&nbsp; &nbsp; <a href="http://web.mit.edu/commreq/cim/course4.html"><i>CI-M Subjects for Undergraduate Majors</i></a>&nbsp; &nbsp; <a href="./search.cgi?search=4&when=J"><i>IAP only</i></a>&nbsp; &nbsp; <a href="https://sisapp.mit.edu/ose-rpt/subjectEvaluationSearch.htm?departmentId=+++4&search=Search"><i>Evaluations</i></a> <a href="http://ist.mit.edu/certificates"><i>(Certificates Required)</i></a></b><hr width="90%" align="center"><table align="center"><tr><td valign=middle><img src="/icns/purple1.gif" width="20" height="20" alt="left arrow"></td><td valign=middle><b> | </b></td><td valign=middle align=center><b><a href="m4a.html">Architecture Design</a></b></td><td valign=middle><b> | </b></td><td valign=middle align=center><b><a href="m4b.html">Architecture Studies</a></b></td><td valign=middle><b> | </b></td><td valign=middle align=center><b><a href="m4c.html">Art, Culture and Technology</a></b></td><td valign=middle><b> | </b></td><td valign=middle align=center><b><a href="m4d.html">Building Technology</a></b></td><td valign=middle><b> | </b></td><td valign=middle align=center><b><a href="m4e.html">Computation</a></b></td><td valign=middle><b> | </b></td><td valign=middle align=center><b><a href="m4f.html">History, Theory and Criticism of Architecture and Art</a></b></td><td valign=middle><b> | </b></td><td valign=middle align=center><b>Thesis and UROP</b></td><td valign=middle><b> | </b></td><td valign=middle><img src="/icns/purple2.gif" width="20" height="20" alt="right arrow"></td></tr></table></div>

<table border=0 width="100%"><tr><td>
<h2>Thesis and UROP</h2>
<h3><br>Graduate Subjects</h3>
<p>Preparatory subjects for thesis are listed within each of the disciplinary headings of the subject listing.
<a name="4.THG"></a>
<p><h3>4.THG Graduate Thesis
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Graduate" title="Graduate" src="/icns/grad.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Fall" title="Fall" src="/icns/fall.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="IAP" title="IAP" src="/icns/iap.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Summer" title="Summer" src="/icns/summer.gif">) <img src="/icns/repeat.gif" alt="Can be repeated for credit" title="Can be repeated for credit" width=16 height=16 align="bottom">
<br>Prereq: Permission of instructor
<br>Units arranged
<br><a href="https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4thg">https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4thg</a>
<br>TBA. <!--s-->
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Program of research and writing of thesis; to be arranged by the student with supervising committee.
<br>Fall: <I>R. Caso</I><br>IAP: <I>R. Caso</I><br>Spring: <I>R. Caso</I><br>Textbooks arranged individually (IAP 2018); No required or recommended textbooks (Spring 2018)
</p><!--end-->
<h3><br>Undergraduate Subjects</h3>
<a name="4.119"></a>
<p><h3>4.119 Preparation for Undergraduate Architecture Design Thesis
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Not offered academic year 2017-2018" title="Not offered academic year 2017-2018" src="/icns/nooffer.gif"><img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Undergrad" title="Undergrad" src="/icns/under.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Fall" title="Fall" src="/icns/fall.gif">)
<br>Prereq: <a href="m4a.html#4.024">4.024</a>
<br>Units: 2-0-10
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Selection of thesis topic, defining method of approach, and preparation of thesis proposal for BSA degree in architecture. Weekly class meeting as well as individual conference with faculty.
<br>Staff<br>
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.THT"></a>
<p><h3>4.THT[J] Thesis Research Design Seminar
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Undergrad" title="Undergrad" src="/icns/under.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Fall" title="Fall" src="/icns/fall.gif">) <img src="/icns/repeat.gif" alt="Can be repeated for credit" title="Can be repeated for credit" width=16 height=16 align="bottom">
<br>(Same subject as <A HREF="m11a.html#11.THT">11.THT[J]</A>)
<br>Prereq: None
<br>Units: 3-0-9
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Designed for students writing a thesis in Urban Studies and Planning or Architecture. Develop research topics, review relevant research and scholarship, frame research questions and arguments, choose an appropriate methodology for analysis, and draft introductory and methodology sections.
<br><I>C. Abbanat</I><br>
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.THU"></a>
<p><h3>4.THU Undergraduate Thesis
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Undergrad" title="Undergrad" src="/icns/under.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Fall" title="Fall" src="/icns/fall.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="IAP" title="IAP" src="/icns/iap.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Summer" title="Summer" src="/icns/summer.gif">) <img src="/icns/repeat.gif" alt="Can be repeated for credit" title="Can be repeated for credit" width=16 height=16 align="bottom">
<br>Prereq: <a href="m4g.html#4.THT">4.THT</a> or <a href="m4a.html#4.119">4.119</a>
<br>Units arranged
<br><a href="https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4thu">https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4thu</a>
<br>TBA. <!--s-->
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Program of thesis research leading to the writing of an SB thesis, to be arranged by the student and an appropriate MIT faculty member. Intended for seniors. 12 units recommended.
<br>Fall: <I>R. Caso</I><br>IAP: <I>R. Caso</I><br>Spring: <I>R. Caso</I><br>Textbooks arranged individually (IAP 2018); No required or recommended textbooks (Spring 2018)
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.UR"></a>
<p><h3>4.UR Undergraduate Research in Design
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Undergrad" title="Undergrad" src="/icns/under.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Fall" title="Fall" src="/icns/fall.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="IAP" title="IAP" src="/icns/iap.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Summer" title="Summer" src="/icns/summer.gif">) <img src="/icns/repeat.gif" alt="Can be repeated for credit" title="Can be repeated for credit" width=16 height=16 align="bottom">
<br>Prereq: Permission of instructor
<br>Units arranged [P/D/F]
<br><a href="https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4ur">https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4ur</a>
<br>TBA. <!--s-->
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Research and project activities, which cover the range represented by the various research interests and projects in the Department.
<br>Fall: <I>R. Caso</I><br>IAP: <I>R. Caso</I><br>Spring: <I>R. Caso</I><br>Textbooks arranged individually (IAP 2018); No required or recommended textbooks (Spring 2018)
</p><!--end-->
<a name="4.URG"></a>
<h3>4.URG Undergraduate Research in Design
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif"></h3>
<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Undergrad" title="Undergrad" src="/icns/under.gif">  (<img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Fall" title="Fall" src="/icns/fall.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="IAP" title="IAP" src="/icns/iap.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Spring" title="Spring" src="/icns/spring.gif">, <img width=16 height=16 align="bottom" alt="Summer" title="Summer" src="/icns/summer.gif">) <img src="/icns/repeat.gif" alt="Can be repeated for credit" title="Can be repeated for credit" width=16 height=16 align="bottom">
<br>Prereq: None
<br>Units arranged
<br><a href="https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4urg">https://architecture.mit.edu/subject/spring-2018-4urg</a>
<br>TBA. <!--s-->
<br><img alt="______" src="/icns/hr.gif">
<br>Research and project activities, which cover the range represented by the various research interests and projects in the department. Students who wish a letter grade option for their work must register for 4.URG.
<br>Fall: <I>R. Caso</I><br>IAP: <I>R. Caso</I><br>Spring: <I>R. Caso</I><br>Textbooks arranged individually (IAP 2018); No required or recommended textbooks (Spring 2018)
</p><!--end-->
</td></tr></table>
